Title: Object: The Dragoman of Mr Colquhoun Consul at Bucharest
Series: Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841
Description: Portrait of a man in oriental dress with a fez and embroidered gown, full-length seated with his right hand on the handle of a weapon tucked into his waistband, looking to right towards a similarly-dressed boy who holds a hookah pipe for him, a woman holding a child behind to left and view of a city beyond, only the boy's figure filled out fully. Hand-coloured lithograph printed in grey and beige
Curator's comments: From a set of lithographs 'Drawn on Stone by Joseph Nash', published in two volumes, London, 1843 and 1846 (1918,0205.2-8). See ODNB for Nash
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (379.12)
